'Somalis' (, ) are an ethnic group located in the Horn of Africa, also known as
the Somali Peninsula. The overwhelming majority of
Somalis speak the Somali language, which is part of the Cushitic branch of the
Afro-Asiatic language family. Ethnic Somalis number around 15-17 million and are
principally concentrated in Somalia (around 8.7 million [https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-
factbook/geos/so.html#People CIA World Factbook: Somalia, people] and
[http://www.lib.utexas.edu/maps/africa/somalia_ethnic_grps_2002.jpg Map of the
Somalia Ethnic groups] (CIA according de
[http://www.lib.utexas.edu/maps/somalia.html Perry-CastaÃ±eda Library Map
Collection]). The first gives 15% non-Somalis and the second 6%. Used 85% of
current population of Somalia. ), Ethiopia (4.6 million ),
Yemen (a little under 1 million), Kenya (900,000 [http://allafrica.com/stories/201001120871.html Kenya: 2009
Census Delayed Over Somali Numbers] Note: Although provisional results
from the 2009 Kenya census reported a much larger number of over 2 million
Somali residents, they are believed to be inaccurate due to reported
inconsistencies in the gathered data. The figure has consequently been nullified
for an official recount; c.f. [http://allafrica.com/stories/201009020398.html].
The 900,000 population estimate is from the 1989 Kenya census. ), Djibouti
(464,600), and an unknown but large number live in parts of the
Middle East, North America and Europe.
categories: Ethnic groups in the Arab League
